Ok I don't know what the guy did when he compressed this, but all the files are incorrectly named, to get the ISO you'll need to do a little renaming to the files, This is done like so:

Original file:			Rename to:
carsx-dgr.001		-> 	carsx-dgr.001.r01
carsx-dgr.002		->	carsx-dgr.001.r02	
carsx-dgr.003		->	carsx-dgr.001.r03
carsx-dgr.004		->	carsx-dgr.001.r04
carsx-dgr.005		->	carsx-dgr.001.r05	
carsx-dgr.006		->	carsx-dgr.001.r06


When you get past file 10, rename the files r10, r11, etc, not r010 r011.
When you get to like file 30, you'll notice the file will not use the winrar icons, ignore that.

Umm and yea use winrar incase you hadnt figured it out. Now the ISO should extract perfectly, worked fine for me anyways.

Actually, you dont have to rename the files. Just open .001 with WinRAR  (rightclick and select application) and you'll be fine. Renaming just makes the file "doubleclickable".
